Articles.Content:
I would love to see support for a multiplayer mission control style interface, where people online or on a local network could view your map and telemetry information, and would be able to plan maneuver nodes and send them to the pilot. This would allow for easier KSP Mission Control parties and I think would be a huge hit.

I know some mods provide similar functionality, but they've been very difficult to get working, and seem hacky at best.

I kind of like the idea but at the same time I wonder if it wouldn't get pretty boring pretty quickly? Planning maneuvers isn't that hard and then executing them is pretty easy too. It seems there would need to be more to it or you'd just be sitting around a lot.
Not to mention, I'm sure there would be trolls who would spam useless nodes

29 minutes ago, Brownhair2 said:

Not to mention, I'm sure there would be trolls who would spam useless nodes

Best just not to invite those guys to the party in the first place.

They eat all twisties.
Seems like a cool idea for a multiplayer mod. Something like Telemachus, but with a mission planning tool.

Yes much like Telemachus, but it would be nice to be able to use the same map interface to plan maneuver nodes. Maybe have an option to disable the map and maneuver node creation on the pilot's game so he is dependent on mission control for all navigation. It seems like a simple enough feature to implement (modders have more or less implemented it already) and it would make KSP an awesome LAN party game.

19 hours ago, KSP Bros KS said:

Trolling only happens in minecraft as far as i have seen.

Trolling and griefing happens in every game that doesn't punish it. In GTA V there are penalties for destroying someone's car/killing them. In MOBAs there are systems that let other people rate others depending on how well they did (though this one isn't as troll-proof).

BUT most of KSP players seem to DO appreciate others' achievements and each thread with a title like "My first orbit!" or "My first Mun lander!" seem to be full of people who actually congratulate the player who did this, so I think that a MOBA-like rating system would work best for this. Players could invite others who have higher/similar rank and cooperate with them (basically levels, except with some fancy titles like Rookie, Astronaut, Captain, etc.). Once a mission is over they would rate how each of the members of the Mission Control did on a scale from 1-5 stars, or something like that, and an average rating would be always displayed (much like it is on seller's page on Amazon). They could also maybe make notes like "This guy is pretty good" or "This player is a rookie and still needs to learn", or "Ths guy is a troll. DON'T play with him/her".

That way players would actualy care about cooperation to avoid reputation loss/comments that are not favourable.
